title: Texas Legislature approves $8.5 billion boost for public schools after years of stagnant funding
description: The Texas House has given final approval to House Bill 2, sending it to Governor Greg Abbott for his expected signature. This legislation allocates approximately $8.5 billion to public schools, providing funds for teacher and staff raises, special education, school safety, and early childhood learning. While the bill includes a per-student increase to base funding and targeted raises for various school staff, it falls short of earlier proposed increases. The funding package follows extensive negotiations and comes after the controversial approval of a private school voucher program.
